components.description:
A yellow face with slightly raised eyebrows, a frown, and eyes looking to the side. May convey a variety of negative emotions, including irritation, displeasure, grumpiness, and skepticism, as if giving the side-eye.

Not to be confused with üòè Smirking Face, which features similar eyes but a wry smile.
components.title: Unamused Face

description:
A yellow face with slightly raised eyebrows, a frown, and eyes looking to the side. May convey a variety of negative emotions, including irritation, displeasure, grumpiness, and skepticism, as if giving the side-eye.

Not to be confused with üòè Smirking Face, which features similar eyes but a wry smile.
title: Unamused Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: This face is not amused. This is not a face of sadness, it is more of a grumpy, displeased look. Used to express dissatisfaction. The eyes a http://emojipedia.org/unamused-face/
emoji_net_data.name: unamused face

bn:00097146a: Troubled persistently especially with petty annoyances
Troubled persistently especially with petty annoyances.

bn:13637363a: Not amused; thus often offended or put off

bn:00112813a: Experiencing or marked by or causing sadness or sorrow or discontent

Lacking or indicating lack of confidence or assurance.

Causing irritation or annoyance; troublesome; vexatious.
Causing irritation, annoyance, or discomfort; bothersome, irksome.

bn:00098530a: Uninterested because of frequent exposure or indulgence

bn:00101516a: Having a strong distaste from surfeit

bn:00110444a: Concerned with work or important matters rather than play or trivialities
Important; weighty; not trifling; leaving no room for play.
Important; weighty; not trifling; leaving no room for play; needing great attention; critical.

bn:00110036a: Feeling mentally uncomfortable because something is missing or wrong.
Experiencing or showing sorrow or unhappiness- Christina Rossetti

bn:00082641v: Cause annoyance in; disturb, especially by minor irritations
To make someone rather angry or impatient; to cause annoyance.

bn:00074505n: A serious facial expression giving no evidence of interest or amusement

bn:00004359n: The act of troubling or annoying someone
An act or instance of annoying.
Act of annoying, vexing or irritating.
Annoyance is an unpleasant mental state that is characterized by such effects as irritation and distraction from one's conscious thinking.
The act of annoying, vexing, or irritating.

bn:00026402n: State of physical and/or psychological dejectedness, which can lead to unhappiness, pessimism and mistrust.
A mental state characterized by a pessimistic sense of inadequacy and a despondent lack of activity
Depression is a state of low mood and aversion to activity that can affect a person's thoughts, behavior, feelings and sense of well-being.
A state of low mood, also known as melancholy
State of low mood and aversion to activity

bn:00071715n: The virtue of speaking truly about one's feelings, thoughts, desires
Sincerity is the virtue of one who speaks truly about his or her own feelings, thoughts, desires.
The quality of being open and truthful; not deceitful or hypocritical
Sincerity is the virtue of one who speaks and acts truly about his or her own feelings, thoughts, and desires.

bn:00004840n: Apathy is most commonly defined as a lack of feeling, emotion, interest, or concern.
A lack of interest; indifference, apathy.
State of indifference or the suppression of emotions
Apathy is a lack of feeling, emotion, interest, or concern.
Complete lack of emotion or motivation about a person, activity, or object; depression; lack of interest or enthusiasm; disinterest.
The trait of lacking enthusiasm for or interest in things generally.
The trait of lacking enthusiasm for or interest in things generally

bn:00012232n: A pit or hole which has been bored.
Boredom is an emotional state experienced when an individual is left without anything in particular to do, and not interested in their surroundings.
Emotional state experienced when an individual is left without anything in particular to do, and not interested in their surroundings
Boredom is a reactive state of emotion that interprets the condition of one's environment as wearingly dull due to repetitive, non-existent or tedious stimuli.
The feeling of being bored by something tedious
Bores are people who inspire boredom, usually through a lack of social skills and an inability to understand that their topics of conversation are of no interest to their listeners.
